Text: Greetings, Hackers and fans. Today, we've got another exciting update for Hack on the Desktop! Hack mode We heard you! Following up on feedback we received in several channels, we removed the concept of a Hack mode from our first class learning environment. In Hack mode, the user had the hacking affordances available, namely the Flip to Hack functionality to look behind an application, see what is happening behind the scenes, modify the application and run it in a sandbox environment. To provide the user with a sense when those affordances were available, the desktop background wallpaper changed and the cursor switched to the Hack cursor. Those changes have been perceived as intrusive (“it spoils the system and it changes your cursor style”). We decided to reduce that barrier of adoption and removed changing the cursor and wallpaper. The hacking affordances are available by default and not tied to a specific mode, so you can still enjoy the Sidetrack quests and use the Hacking Toolbox on the flip side of the app to solve the riddles. The pinned desktop icon, which previously had an on/off state, is now reduced to a single-state icon. Open sourcing We are very happy to announce that Hack is now fully open source. All of the components have been released under an open source license. The are available on GitHub. The Clubhouse, the place to start your Hack journeys and meet your heroes. The Hacking apps, this includes the System app, Sidetrack and some other so called toy apps. The Sound server to play back sounds in quests, the Clubhouse and Hack applications. The Hacking toolbox which provides tools to modify the apps. TheGame State service which keeps track of your progress in quests. The GNOME Shell Hack extension which adds functionality like FlipToHack to the GNOME Shell. Clippy, a library to expose Gtk applications internals for scripting engines to implement interactive lessons in real time in the apps themself. We hope you remain loyal to the Hack experience! Happy hacking - see you on Hack Lab, or in the Endless Community Forums!

Greetings, Hackers and fans. Today, we've got another exciting update for Hack Lab! Badges Hack Lab now has badges! Complete the activities, and show off your accomplishments to your friends and family! Translations If you hablas español you're in luck - We're rolling out our first translation of Hack Lab! We know how important it is to be able to learn in your own language, so if you want to see Hack Lab in your langauge, we'd love to hear from you! Privacy and Data Policies...? As part of following European Union laws about data collection and privacy, we're updating our privacy policies at Endless. We wouldn't mention this if we only cared about complying with the law - instead, this is an opportunity to show you, our users, that it's important for you to know what data we want to collect and why. We added Google Analytics to Hack Lab to track where in the world you all connect from, what langauges you use, and how you're using the site. We want to track what activities you enjoy the most, and where you might be hitting bugs or rough spots. We don't tie this to specific users, though - it's all anonymous. You'll see a little banner asking you about cookies and analytics the next time you go to an Endless website. Please enable cookies if you can! Happy hacking - we hope to see you on try.hack-computer.com, or in the Endless Community Forums!
Learn about the 45 American Presidents in this Google Chrome Experiment built by SVG and Javascript.

Have you ever broken something and got into trouble? It was the same for Param Jaggi, but he went on to be a CEO at the age of 19 invented the "CO2ube" that reduce carbon emissions on a motor vehicle by 50%! Who says breaking things can't be a positive experience?

This is coding too:
Chris Pattle created the Simpsons characters all in HTML and CSS. You can learn how to draw shapes using the Art pathway. What would you like to draw using code?

Hey, Hackers! We know you haven't heard from us in a while - but that's because we've been working on a new surprise! Today, we're proud to present Hack Web! Hack Web is the test-drive for Hack that you've all been waiting for. Now, it's easier than ever to show your friends, family and teachers what Hack is all about! As an added bonus, Hack Web contains a sneak preview of our new, redesigned p5.js activity! Come and Hack with us at try.hack-computer.com. Although we don't support mobile right now, most laptops should work fine. We also require a "modern" browser, but if you have any current version of Chrome, Firefox, or Safari, you should be fine. If you need any help, or have any feedback, please let us know on the Endless Community Forums!
Morse code helps you to communicate with others in a new way. Try this fun little web app that's built with Javascript to help you learn Morse code on your browser or Gboard.
Have you ever made homemade slime? How far can you stretch it? Ciela Villa broke the Guinness World Record for stretching homemade slime at the age of 10. Click the image to check out their story.
Let's keep celebrating Spring with a wild background. Don't the colors pop? Grab yours today from the Hideout.
Do you love puzzle games? Try this addictive and challenging puzzle demo in three dimensions in your Chrome browser. Rotopo was built using WebGL. How far can you go without falling?
Have you tried the "Make the change you want to see" activity in Maker pathway yet? If you have the chance to make the world better, what would your idea be? Wanna see what others think?
Spring is here, and there's no better way than to express your happiness than using our new background. Our orange background is based on the default Hack background. Get it from the Hideout today.
Help Bishop the Lamb get back to Earth safe and unharmed after having got into trouble during a long trip through the universe! This web project was build with WebGL and WebRTC. Have fun!
Have you ever had trouble getting your pringles out of the bottom of your box? Well, Georgia Dinsley created the perfect Hack for you at the age of 11!

The Hack art team is at it again. Based on the Hack default background, they created a dark blue version. You can download it from the Hideout today. Which one is your favorite so far? DM us on social at #MadeToHack.

Given an image to recreate, Geometrize generates hundreds of random shapes and repeatedly mutates these as part of a hillclimbing optimization approach. This demo uses code that ranks thousands of shapes behind the scenes, only picking the best-fitting shapes for use in the final image. Upload an image and see what happens.

Summer is around the corner; what is your favorite water sport? Did you know that Ralph Samuelson invented water skis at the age of 18? He loved snow skiing and aquaplaning so much he built the first water skis in 1922.

The Hack team loves cats! When we were making Saniel's cats, each member of the team drew cats as a team exercise. Head over to the Hack Hideout, download the worksheet and draw cats of your own. When you're finished, don't forget to share it with us by tagging the post with #MadeToHack. We can't wait to see what you'll come up with.

This new experiment is making use of machine learning to discover extraordinary details in some of the most famous Japanese screens and scrolls from different eras. This journey from one beautiful detail to another within Japanese masterpieces is a new way to understand why screens and scrolls from Japan are one of the most celebrated art forms worldwide.

An eye injury blinded Louis Braille at the age of 3. At the age of 15, he invented the raised series of dots that make the Braille alphabet to help the visually impaired people to read. Click on the image to read his story.

Love Hack? The fantastic art team at Hack created coloring sheets for you to fill in. Use your art skills and express yourself. When you're done, take a pic of your favorite character and share it on social media. Don't forget to tag it with #MadeToHack so we can see it. We'll share our favorite pics.

The Searching Planet is a project that lets you see the world through the lens of “Internet search.” By looking at Google Trends data, we get a sense of what people around the world are interested in. Can you guess what people around the world are searching about?
We brought back the Techbridge Girls to test Hack right before our initial launch. Read what happens at our blog.
Don't let the April showers get you down. Download and install the blue desktop background the Hack artists made exclusively for our fans. Head over to the Hack Hideout today.

Discover the accomplishments of activists, artists, scientists, business leaders, writers, civic leaders, and more—right on the money in your wallet. The app will display notable women of history on your bills.

What happens when you fill a room with about 30 middle-schoolers, as well as a handful of designers, game developers, and marketers? You get Hack! Read more about the story when Techbridge Girls visited our headquarters in San Francisco.

Mildred Dresselhaus was the daughter of Polish Jewish immigrants and a New Yorker. She became the first woman ever to become an Institute Professor at MIT —a professor with the highest title. She taught there for 57 years and contributed to research on carbon, which helped the development of nanotechnology—used in everyday technology such as smartphones. She won the Presidential Medal of Freedom and the National Medal of Science, among many.

Emoji Scavenger Hunt is an experiment that leverages the power of neural networks and your phone's camera to identify the real-world versions of the emojis we use every day. Find the real-life version of the emoji before the time runs out. Happy emoji hunting!
At the age of 14, Santiago Gonzalez has made over a dozen games for iOS and Android. He is also fluent in many different programming languages. Check out his amazing story.
Make your friends green with envy. The Hack art team put together a green background just in time for Spring. Download the background from the Hack Hideout and show your Spring spirit.

You have landed on an alien planet and must refuel your ship to continue on your journey. Program your trusty feline sidekick F3lix to help you on this adventure to collect resources and battle alien monsters. Work together to explore this newly discovered world, get through the obstacles and challenges, and find a way out.
Meet Karthick Arun, the youngest Amazon Cloud expert at nine years old. With the help of his father, he studied every day and passed the 90-minute test in less than half an hour. Great job!

Hack March Release Today, we proudly announce Hack's March Release! We hope you like it - let us know what you think on social media with #MadeToHack! In this release, we're (officially) introducing GIMP, after a sneak peek in last month's create-a-cursor quest. GIMP is a fully-featured, free, open-source photo editor, much like Photoshop! Note: A recent version of GIMP has been released that was not able to start. This issue has been fixed. If you encounter this issue, please update using the available application update mechanisms. We've also got some more Blender tutorials, on how to make and texture a low-poly Well, and some new activities that explore the internals of p5.js! Edit a Photo - Making it Look Right Learn to remove blemishes, adjust light exposure and color saturation, and crop a picture. Play Now! Edit a Photo - Changing The Look Learn to use a bunch of tools in GIMP that can massively change how a photo looks! Play Now! Edit a Photo - Adding something new!Learn to use the Smart Scissors Tool to "cut" an object from one picture and "paste" it into another! Play Now! "Well" it Blend?In part 1 of this quest, you'll learn to model a low-poly well, just the kind of piece your 3D art portfolio can use! Play Now! "Well" it Blend - The RoofIn part 2 of this quest, you'll complete the roof, and pave the way for part 3. Play Now! "Well" it Blend - Textures and lightingIn part 3 of this quest, you'll learn to texture and light the low-poly well to make it really pop! Play Now! "Well" it Blend - SourcesIn part 4 of this activity, you'll get the sources, so you can compare them against your own efforts! Play Now! P5JS - Exploring Colors with Variables!In the first part of this activity, you'll learn how to use variables to make P5JS even easier! Play Now! P5JS - Variables and random()!In part 2 of this activity, you'll use variables with random() to generate random colors! Play Now! P5JS - Changing colors with your mouse!In part 3 of this activity, it's time to tie it all together and control the randomness with your mouse. Play Now! This month, we're going forward at full speed - Learn more about Bootstrap, and learn how to set up a multi-page website! Bootstrap Like a Web Developer Level up your Bootstrap game by learning how to link files for your project. Play Now! Link it Up Upgrade your single page website to a multiple page website Play Now!
Where do you #HACK? At school, by the pool, or your favorite restaurant? We want to see it! Post a picture of you using Hack at your favorite place and tag us (#MadeToHack) in it.

Can you control the chaos? Hack your way into the cyberpunk world of Ovum City. Debug broken code, solve puzzles, and upgrade your hardware as you explore this open world. Don't get caught by the drones! It's up to you how Ovum City evolves.

Meaidaibahun Majaw used her coding skills to build over 40 apps by the age of 9. One of her apps allow kids to report bullying to the school authorities, parents, teachers, and other guardians. Way to Hack for good!
Hackers unite! Put on your hacker sunglasses and download the Hack Maxtrix wallpaper from the Hideout today.
Song Maker is a simple way for anyone to make and share a song. Give it a try and make some music with your browser.

For his seventh birthday, Ashwat Prasanna’s parents gave him a MacBook. Three years and one Apple boot camp later, his free measurement-converter app, Quickvert, has been downloaded more than 1,000 times on the App Store. Way to go!
Hack protip: Are you tired of typing the same commands in terminal or can't remember what you executed before? Press the up and down arrow keys to cycle through the history of commands.

People love singing with Freddie Mercury, but can you sing like Freddie too? We made an AI-powered singing challenge to find out. This experiment uses new, on-device machine learning models developed by Google Research to see how close your timbre, pitch, and melody are to Freddie’s. Your audio doesn’t get uploaded to servers to be analyzed, so your vocals stay private.

Isabel Sieh started coding when she was 11 years old using online courses. After discovering her passion for programming, Sieh started her company called "Girls Will Code". Sieh believes that it is easier to learn when you’re part of a community, so she started the company aimed at helping young girls who are also interested in coding. They also encourage schools to implement coding as an after school activity. Awesome!
Do you love pop art? Download the Hack pop art wallpaper for your desktop today.

Teachable Machine is a web tool that makes it fast and easy to create machine learning models for your projects, no coding required. Train a computer to recognize your images, sounds, & poses, then export your model for your sites, apps, and more.

In the span of 9 years, Reuben Paul became Accomplished Hacker, App Developer, Cyber Security and the CEO of Prudent Games. He has been a guest speaker in many Cyber Security conferences to raise awareness about growing cyber threats. Check out his story by clicking the image.
Hack protip: Can't remember the command you executed a long time ago in terminal? Hit CTRL + R to trigger the search feature and start typing.

Hack February Release Today, we proudly announce Hack's February Release! We hope you like it - let us know what you think on social media with #MadeToHack! The following content has been added: Sidetrack #2 - Detect changes in code editor We have added additional code to detect if the user has solved errors in the code editor, and added it into the second part of the Sidetrack quest. We've also made some small changes to improve the guidance for FlipToHack, as well. Sidetrack #3 - The Wall A new instruction opens up new possibilities to solve Sidetrack's puzzles! This quest will become available in the games pathway when Sidetrack 2 is completed. Terminal 2 - Missile Math A new game from Endless Studios. Dodge the missiles and shoot down the enemy planes, using the power of mathematics, in this fast-paced flight shooter! Play Now! P5JS - Painting with Sound Over the course of this 3-part series, you'll learn to build a program that lets you visualize any sound that your computer's microphone can pick up! Play Now! P5JS - Animated GIF Collage In this 3-part series, you'll learn how to load images from the web into a p5.js sketch, play/pause them on demand, and fill your screen with a sea of animation! Play Now! Blender - Modeling and Animating a Low-Poly Person Another great Blender quest series! In part 1 of this activity, you'll create a 3d model of a realistically-sized low-poly person, for use any any later projects you want to make. In part 2 of this activity, you'll learn to rig and animate your low-poly person to do whatever cool moves you like! In part 3 of this activity, you'll get the sources for part 1 and 2, to compare against your own efforts. Play Now! Krita - Fun With Photos Start with a photo, end with a work of art! You'll learn to change the look of a photograph and add all kinds of decorations. Play Now! Krita - Just My Color Start with a simple picture, then change its color and add a background. Quick and easy! Play Now! Web - Bootstrapping your way to faster websites Learn to use Bootstrap, one of the fastest and most popular web libraries out there! Play Now! Maker - Clouds in a Jar You probably see clouds a lot - but do you know how they work? Let's capture your very own water cycle in a jar! Play Now! OperatingSystem - New Cursor Create your very own mouse pointer (cursor) that you can use across the entire operating system! Play Now! Other Improvements and Changes Visual representation of chained quests We have recently introduced the concept of chained quests - such as the Sidetrack quest series. For example, in order to play Sidetrack #2, you must first complete Sidetrack #1, and so on. Previously, unavailable quests were hidden - Sidetrack #2 was not visible when Sidetrack #1 was incomplete. We have changed this, and now display all available quests. However, locked quests are grayed out and can not be flipped. Hovering over the grayed-out card will show a tooltip explaining the requirements to unlock that quest. We hope this will more accurately represent the available content. We're always refining the Hack UI, though, and we welcome your suggestions and feedback. Let us know in the forum or at #madetohack on social media! Visual representation of narrative quests It might be a surprise to some of our users that we have two major types of quests available in the Clubhouse - First are the activities that help your learn and create, but there's also a second type, narrative quests. Narrative quests drive the story of the world of Hack and its characters, and tell how you, the player, fit in! Our users and playtesters have given us the feedback that it's difficult to tell the difference, and that's important - when you want an activity, we don't want to force you to sit through a story! Hovering over the cards for narrative quests will now display a "book" icon, to help identify them. Canceling of quests Quests can be canceled by clicking the 'x' icon of the dialogue. For narrative quests, that button wasn't available, so there was no correct way to cancel them, which wasn't ideal. With this change, the play button for all running quests will turn into a cancel button, allowing you to cancel any quest. New instructors/mentors We are very happy to have grown the guild of Hack mentors! We've added 2 new instructor avatars, cousins of your friend the Daemon, from other systems! Look for them in current and upcoming quests... especially in this month's Krita quests!

Improve your typing skills while competing in fast-paced races with up to 5 typers from around the world. Compete against your friends, earn new cars, track your scores, and so much more... all for free!
At the age of 12, Bianca hacked the voting reporting system at DEFCON 26. She a coder, maker, and the founder of Girls Who Hack. Check out her story by clicking the image.
Here at Hack, we love cats. Show your love by downloading our exclusive cat background.

Play a duet with the computer through your browser. Just play some notes, and the computer will respond to your melody. You don’t even have to know how to play piano—it’s fun to just press some keys and listen to what comes back. You can click the keyboard, use your computer keys, or even plug in a MIDI keyboard. It's just one example of how machine learning can inspire people to be creative in new ways.

Tanmay Bakshi was curious about programming at an early age since his father worked as a Programmer. At the age of 7, Bakshi setup a YouTube channel where he posted tutorials on coding and web development. By the age of eight, he taught himself how to develop iOS apps and published his first app at the age of nine. Now he's partnering with IBM Watson on deep learning. We can't wait to see what he'll do next!

Conduct your own virtual orchestra in the browser by moving your arms. You can move your arms to change the tempo, volume, and instrumentation of a piece of music. It uses PoseNet, a machine learning library that works in the browser, to map out your movements through your webcam. An algorithm plays along to the score as you conduct, using hundreds of tiny audio files from live recorded instruments.
Hack protip: Use the fn + any arrow key to quickly jump to different parts of the browser page; arrow up to page up, arrow down to page down, left to go home, and right to go to the end.
Hannah Laird, 8 years old and the youngest of all competitors, won an international coding challenge. Way to go!
Hack protip: Easily take a full screenshot on your Hack computer by pressing the "prt sc" (print screen) key. Hold shift + "prt sc" and drag around the area you want for a shot of smaller area.
Can you stump an AI? Draw a picture in 20 seconds and the AI will try to guess what it is. It won't always work, but the more you play with it, the more it will learn.

At the age of 8, Zara Khanna, built a chatbot called Octa to help kids find fun things to do when they travel. Now founder of her own company, she has big plans to change the travel industry. Check out her story by clicking on the picture.
Hack Protip: Quickly search for an app on your Hack by pressing the Hack (Windows) button and typing what you're looking for.

Hack January Release Today, we proudly announce Hack's January Release! We hope you like it - let us know what you think on social media with #MadeToHack! The following content has been added: Sidetrack 2 - Flip To Hack Riley continues presenting her game project, and introduces the "Flip To Hack" system that lets you delve into the code and change as the game runs! Debug that pesky broken instruction in Level 23, and push ahead into new territory! This quest will become available in the games pathway when Sidetrack 1 is completed. Make your own Happiness Sometimes, doing something to help someone else can make you feel just fantastic. In this new activity, learn some strategies for making a positive impact on someone close to you. Play Now! Building Your Own Adventure Saniel's got a new activity for you - It's time to make a little adventure game, using nothing but the filesystem of your computer! The best part about it is that when you're done, you can pass it to a friend or parent, and they can play it too! Play Now! DOMinating the Web! Riley and the Daemons have a new Web activity for you to try, and it's all about dominating the webpages you make and visit! Learn how to use the DOM tree to think about how webpages are constructed, and see how you can use that layout to cleverly select and change specific parts of the webpage, like in the Inspector. Play Now! LMMS - Learning to make music, beats, and sounds In this all-new suite of activities, we're introducing LMMS - a fully-featured, free, open-source digital audio workbench! It's used by both professionals and hobbyists, and it's your gateway into creating music and sounds with Hack! After you've mastered the basics, Estelle even walks you through making some retro sound effects that you might use in a game someday... LMMS 1 (Intro) - Play Now! LMMS 2 (Making Beats) - Play Now! LMMS 3 (Sound Effects) - Play Now! Whitehouse A new game from Endless Studios. Change the world around you using CSS and Web colors, and explore a white-washed town. Play Now!

Make sweet music with a few simple clicks and share it with your friends using this online sequencer. You can also listen to music created by the community. Click on the image to listen to one of our favorite creations.

When he was 12-year-old, Thomas Suarez built a whack-a-mole mobile app called "Bustin Jeiber". Now he's 20 years old and an augmented reality software and electronics engineer. Click on the picture to check out his story.

Hack protip: Maximize your desktop space and snap your browser window like a pro. Press and hold the Hack (Windows) button and press the left or right arrow to snap to the side, up for full-screen, and down for a smaller window.

Need a coding break? Check out Paperio3 for a quick multiplayer online game.
You are born in a random field in the paper-io, move your mouse to get more space for yourself,
but don't get caught by other players, because they want to kill you.

Brittany Wenger, taught herself to code in middle school. At 15, her cousin was diagnosed with breast cancer so she created Cloud4Cancer, an AI breast cancer app that took first place in the 2012 Google Science Fair. Brittany successfully trained the network to have a 99.11% accuracy rate in determining whether a sample of breast tissue is malignant or benign. She is now studying at Duke University.

We can't wait to see what you'll do next!

Baltimore Third Grader, Paxton Summers, wins NASA's and Tynker's "Mission Design Patch Challenge" coding contest. Nice work!
Have you created something from the Art or Maker pathway? Send us a photo and we will feature our favorites in the newsfeed.
Hey everyone! We’re going to pull back the curtain for a minute here, because something really cool is happening!
That’s right, Ada. Hack is coming to Pepcom! Pepcom is a mini-conference that showcases new and upcoming software and tech to the media!
That’s pretty cool by itself, but what that means for YOU, our community, is that we’re going to be in front of a ton of journalists!
Exactly, Ada. Expect to see articles about Hack and Endless coming out soon! If you’ve got friends, family, or anyone else you want to share Hack with, this is your moment.
Yep! We’re hoping to see the Hack community grow even more in the near future – We’re rolling out content updates and expanding our reach every month!
wow that’s gonna be a lot more remote students, huh?
Indeed. I think we’ll be able to cope, though – We have a good, solid structure in place for them.
I can’t wait to meet more kids through Hack!
this is gonna be so awesome!
From all of us here at Hack – Thanks for sticking with us so far, and let’s keep learning about coding together. Hack the planet!
Ethan taught himself to code in about three months during the summer, published over 3 apps, spoke at SXSW, and just won a 10k scholarship from Amazon. Way to go, Ethan!
Ahhh, I always get such a feeling of freedom every New Year!
A New Year is a momentous time. Many cultures throughout history have placed great significance on the end of the old year and the beginning of the new.
staying up late is pretty cool
but i just hang with my friends online lol
New Years’ seems to be a time when everyone in the world is doing the same thing at the same time – Think about how rare that is!
@Ada Isn’t January 1st your birthday?
Oh! Yes, yes it is, Estelle. I just tend to wrap it up in all the other celebrations, there’s so much to celebrate!
@Ada that’s an interesting birthday, bet there aren’t too many people who share that one with you.
@Ada heh did your parents let you choose if it was jan 1st or december 31st?
@Riley I don’t recall having any choice in the matter, but then again I don’t recall what time I was born.
Anyway, it’s nice having a birthday today, I get to celebrate both the year and myself. We’re both starting another trip around the sun at the same time!
crazy to think of exactly WHAT a new year means – just another swing around that lucky old sun of ours.
@Faber You know, we’re not really even close to the same place we were a year ago, in terms of space. The entire galaxy has rotated in that time.
woah
@Riley nuts, right?
And yet, it seems like we’ve never moved at all. Perspective is everything.
@Saniel Exactly! This is the perfect time to try and find a new one on the coming 365 days.
Speaking of which, does everyone have New Years’ resolutions?
@Ada eat more chocolate
ok no seriously, solve more mysteries. for real.
@Ada I’m planning on examining my beliefs and personal truths, and cataloging them to find out which ones I think are most important.
@Ada I’m going spend this year trying to make the Academy the best it can be. We’ve got a great future here, I know it!
@Ada being the best friend I can be to all of you. that’s always been one of the most important things for me.
Wow, those are some pretty powerful resolutions! I have one of my own, too. This year… I’m going to try to take more risks, and be more open to the powers of luck and coincidence.
@Ada grab life as it comes at you, and hold on tight! we’re all here to back you up.
@Faber Thanks. It means a lot to me to have friends like all of you.
Hacking for the holidays? Share your favorite holiday hacks on social media by tagging your post with #MadeToHack. We'll share our favs in our newsletter.
Samaira started coding at 6 and at the age of 8, she created a game to teach kids to code. Now a CEO of her own company, there's nothing she can't accomplish.
From all of us at Endless - We hope you have a Happy Holidays!
Hey everyone at The Academy! I want to wish you all a Merry Christmas, and any other holiday you’d like to celebrate as we come to the end of the year!
@Ada man, I love the end of the year, so many great times and parties to throw.
@Ada oh heck yes christmas break here I come
@Ada Have a Happy Holidays, Ada.
@Ada Have a great time with your vacation! Are you planning a trip, or anything?
@Estelle Oh, no, I’m not a big fan of traveling. But I do have a large backlog of research journals to catch up on, so I’m looking forward to getting a lot of uninterrupted reading time.
@Ada bwahhh spending your entire vacation reading journals, dang
@Riley Research journals are quite relaxing for me, much like your favorite graphic novels, Riley.
@Ada nah I wasn’t trying to say they were bad, it just sounds like work to me when you’re supposed to be on vaycay
sometimes ‘work’ can be pretty relaxing. remember when we built that little bugbot, @Riley?
@Faber oh yeah that was great
@Riley yeah, and we were really going hard on that for 2 weeks, at least an hour a day every day. didn’t feel like work, did it?
@Faber except when we were soldering those tiny sensors… ugh
@Riley Highly skillful effort can be just as rewarding as leisure, Riley. The more experienced you are, the more a problem seems like an opportunity to learn and improve.
@Estelle and I guess thats why you’re always doing orbital calculations lol
@Riley Well, that and curiosity!
It’s so nice to have some time to yourself. What’s everyone’s favorite holiday drink?
@Ada glogg! it’s Swedish and boy, it is good!

Are you a Lego maniac? Create your own Lego design and built it in real life with this design application. Tag #MadeToHack on your designs and we'll like our favs.
At the age of 7, Kedar Narayan is solving real-world problems with code. Check out his Ted talk as he explains how he invented Storibot, a code-based board game for the blind.

Hack December Release Today, we proudly announce Hack's December Release! We hope you like it - let us know what you think on social media with #MadeToHack! The following content has been added: Midnightmare Teddy: Banish the nightmares from your bedroom, armed only with your trusty equation rifle and the knowledge of mathematics! Play Now! Monster Smoothie, Parts 1-7: In this 7-part quest, you'll learn how to create your very own complete Blender scene, including a spooky monster, a crazy old man, lighting effects, atmosphere, and more! Part 7 lets you dig into the actual files used to create the tutorial to see exactly how it was done. Play Now! Introduction to Processing, Parts 1-4: Begin your journey into the world of Processing, a lightweight, art-focused programming language. In these quests, you'll learn how to draw shapes, use the mouse to move them, and even create a simple painter. Play Now! The Inspector, Parts 1 and 2: Let Ada introduce you to a hidden feature in every web browser - the Inspector. Pick apart and hack any webpage on the internet and learn how it's all put together! Play Now! Make A Poster: Use you knowledge of CSS and HTML to make your very own "wanted" poster - then transform it into whatever you want... maybe a holiday greeting card? Play Now! Tension and Compression: Learn about the principles of tension and compression, and why a well-designed building would actually work just as well suspended in the sky! Play Now! The Wobblin' Shell-Bash: Saniel's got a challenge for you - Through the basics of shell-scripting, learn to control the impressive "Wobbly Windows" feature. Play Now! Sidetrack 1 - Robots and Pits: Place instructions in the correct order to help Riley get through the maze! You’ll need to think carefully and plan out your moves, because when Felix arrives, things just get more complex... Play Now!
@Faber Hello, Faber. Is this how you send a private message?
@Saniel yep. what’s up, doc?
@Saniel sorry! couldn’t resist XD
@Faber … Yes. I have a… research question that I’d like another perspective on.
@Saniel any time! hope the subject is something I can help with
@Faber I hope so. The subject is… personal in nature.
@Saniel personal? like, related to your previous research?
@Faber … Er, no. Personal. As in, relating to aspects of my personal life. I’m asking for this advice in a strictly non-professional capacity.
@Saniel want to make sure I got all this right
@Saniel you want my opinion on a personal question
@Sanilel about your personal life?
@Faber Yes.
@Saniel saniel rowe, are you asking me for dating advice???
@Faber NO!
@Faber …That’s not strictly correct. I need advice on a gift.
@Saniel a gift?
@Faber It’s the holidays very soon, Faber. Traditionally, the holidays are when close friends and family exchange gifts, to promote goodwill and happiness in the coming year... (1/5)
@Saniel I found my calendar last month so I did remember the end of the year is coming up… sorry to cut you off
@Faber Well. Apologies. I’m rambling.
@Saniel nah man I get you, it’s a tough decision. who’s the present for?

@Faber Well, she’s a very… formidable woman. Quite intelligent. Very driven. She has a mischievous streak, definitely. I was thinking that she might appreciate a bound edition of the last 5 issues of The Journal Of Computational Linguistics – very handy.
@Saniel uh, please don’t take this the wrong way, but that’s a terrible present.
@Faber What? How could that be so terrible? It’s a massively important journal for the field!

@Saniel totally, I know it is, but that present is from your outside. that’s the Saniel you show everyone. gifts should be from your heart, from the part you don’t show most people, that’s what makes them special!
@Faber I… don’t quite see, but I think I get what you’re driving at. The gift should be… unexpected?
@Saniel sort of, yeah, like in a way that shows you’re really paying attention to that person and what they like.
@Faber Hm. Then perhaps… Yes. I have an idea.
@Saniel nice
@Saniel what’s cooking up there, dude?
@Faber I have decided. I assume you know of the Voyager probes?
@Saniel definitely. tiny little bits of hardware sailing off into the deep black… some seriously good engineering on those things.

@Faber Yes, well, you know there was a golden record attached to one of those probes – it contained greetings, music, and messages that tried to represent as much of Earth’s culture as possible. I’m going to create a copy. That will be my gift.
@Saniel awesome! that’s more like it, something unexpected, from the heart. great present!
@Faber Thank you, Faber, for your help.
@Saniel anytime. you already knew what to do, though. trust your feelings, doc, you’ve got a good heart.
@Faber Well, if you say so. Now, to find a record-pressing company that does small runs...
